New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player to hit 50 home runs and steal 50 bases in the same season.
Shohei Ohtani went 6-for-6 with three home runs, 10 RBIs, and two stolen bases in a single game.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani's performance clinched a postseason berth for the Los Angeles Dodgers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani's game was compared to other historic performances, including Shawn Green's 6-for-6 day and Mark Whiten's 12-RBI game.
Shohei Ohtani's performance as a designated hitter was noted as one of the greatest.
Others: Shohei Ohtani's two-way performance in a previous game was mentioned as another milestone.
